content.description:
P1: 5.7, 28m

Grimper le dièdre qui monte vers une rampe végétal qui angle vers la gauche et se dirige vers un petit ressaut et un flake qui rejoint un ancrage. Utiliser l'ancrage si vous faite seulement le premier pitch sinon monter quelque mètre et faite un relais sur pro.(beaucoup plus à l'aise bien moins de corde dans face du grimpeur dans le flake) 28 mètres

P2: 5.5, 30-40m

Très beau pour le grade, grimper tout droit en suivant la ligne la plus propre. Relais sur pro quand le drag rend l'expérience moins intéressante.

P3: 5.7, 35m

Continuer de suivre la ligne la plus propre sur environ 10 mètres jusqu'à la magnifique fissure presque verticale dans un mur lisse. Grimper la fissure qui passe de doigts à main. Rendu sur le ledge avec le gros bloc, grimper la fissure un peu à droite pour se rendre au relais qui devrait déjà être visible.

Descente

Avec deux cordes de 70m, rappeler dans la voie en deux rappels. 
Avec deux cordes de 60m, rappeler en diagonale vers la droite (du grimpeur) pour utiliser les relais de blues de la brosse à dent.



la voie commence dans le dièdre juste à gauche de fantaisie spatial 

Rack double à cause des relais sur pro

Route partageant le même départ que Astro, au lieu d'aller à gauche sur la vire végétale après le premier dièdre, aller légèrement sur la droite dans un cicatrice blanche sur la roche pour  rejoindre le dièdre plus haut vers un petit devers. Cette section est sale niveau champignon (2022) et il manque les deux plaquettes sur le bolts alors nous avons finit sur le relais de fantaisie spatiale.

Route sharing the same start as Astro, instead of going left on the vegetal ledge after the first dihedral, go slightly to the right in a white rock scar to join the dihedral higher up to a small overhang. This section is dirty with mushroom (2022) and the two hangers on the bolts are missing so we ended up on the Fantaisie spatiale belay.



Même départ que Astro dans un beau dièdre. 

Same start as Astro in a great dihedral.

trad

Route très direct dans un mur bien verticale. Il y a très peu de reliefs dans la roche mise à part des pockets un peu partout comme c'est souvent le cas au Grands-Jardins.

--- 

Direct route in a perfectly vertical wall. There is very little shapes in the rock except for pockets everywhere as it is often the case at the Grands-Jardins.



Du secteur de Astro et PufPufPuf. Continué au bas de la falaise jusqu'à la seule ligne sportive du secteur (2022)

--- 

From Astro and PufPufPuf sector. Follow the base of the cliff until you see the only bolts line (2022)

11 draws + anchors

Pitch 1 (25-30 m): Climb one of the many options to reach the small dihedral that defines the route. The second half is great with solid rock of weird shape forming very good holds.

Pitch 2: unknown



Just left of The large chimney of PufPufPuf, the route starts on clean rock. Many start option.

standard rack, first belay is bolted with 2 quick links for rappel.

Lots of variations! Pitch 1: -Up the spur 5.6 / 35m -Up the crack system on the right 5.7 / 35m -up the crack on the right and into a beautiful corner 5.7+ / 35m Pitch 2: -Left crack 5.8+ / 40m -Center crack (2 glue-ins) 5.8 / 40m -Fist crack 5.7 / 45m -Right side diagonal crack 5.6 / 60m (belay possible on pins) Pitch 3: straight up. Standard rack
Bolted belay-raps (please leave room for other parties and people descending)

climbs.name: Le blues de la brosse à dent

content.description:
Pitch 1 (25 m): Same first pitch as PufPufPuf. 

Pitch 2( 35 m): Choose one of three small dihedral straight above the belay and continue straight up until you reach the belay station at the top of PufPufPuf. Nice finger cracks in the lower section then joggy pinch. Great rock quality.



The trail reach the base of La Directe de L'ours. Follow the wall to the left (and up) of about 70 meters until you reach a huge chimney (about 3 meters wide). There you go!

standard rack, 2 bolted belays with rap rings

The route start in the obvious hollow.

Pitch 1 (15-20 m): Establish yourself under the little roof and pass it on your left. Boulder up to the top of the broken hollow and reach the slab. Follow the crack system until you reach a fixed anchor, clip it and traverse left to another fixed anchor which is more convenient for belaying. (5.8)

Pitch 2 (60m): Follow the crack system above the belay to the vertical section, pass it to gain some moderate terrain. Keep following the crack system to another vertical section that heads slightly on your right hand side. Again, gain some more moderate terrain to a fixed archor. (5.8)

Pitch 3: At this point you meet with La DIrecte (de L’Ours). Right above the belay, head for the finger crack that seams to disappear. Climb it and gain the slab, clip the bolt and reach the last anchor. (5.6)

Descent: With two (2) 60 m rope you can rappel La DIrecte (de L’Ours).


When you reach the cliff from the approach trail, go around the arete that is on your left, and its the first route on your right.
to Camalot #4. There are fixed anchors on the route.

The route is in a large chimney (3 meters wide).  Pitch 1 (15-20 m): Follow the dihedral on the left (right facing) side of the chimney on a series of small ledges (grass and loose rocks). Traverse left at the end of the pitch to find a (easy to spot) belay station with 2 rap rings. Pitch 2 (35 m): Return right to continue in the dihedral of pitch 1 (on the left side of the chimney). Perfectly cutted low anlged dihedral for about 10 meters, wow. Layback it or stem it... Continue up and slightly left until you reach a second belay station with 2 rap rings. Good placement on all the route, The rock is pretty solid. Parking: accessible by Route 381, at the Mont-du-Lac-des-Cygnes Visitors Centre. Take Le Pioui trail and turn right at the sign for the climbing wall.

When you arrive at the crag, the route is at your left, it is in the big dihedral. Both anchors are bolted with rap rings, you can rap (two rappels) with a single 70 meters rope (and its propably possible to do it a a single 60m since the pitch 2 rappel is 32.5 meters).

As you come into the parc, Mont de l'Ours is the first main cliff visible on the right side (east). 
 The cliff is a mix of cracks in the moderate range 5.5 - 5.9+ 
 It faces the west so it's pretty useful for the limits of the rock climbing season. 
 All routes are trad with some glued bolted belay/rap stations. 
 Having 2 ropes is mandatory since a lot of the routes in the park can be 50m stretchers, there are no intermediate rap stations. 
 the main rap is going down La Directe's glue-ins, just be careful when pulling the rope on the last rap, there's a lot of slots, flakes and pockets to that may turn your evening into an epic getting your rope unstuck.
